Also you shouldn't use float for money. you should use BigDecimal
otherwise you cna introduce floating point issues

All customers are VIP members
some are gold and some aren't.
Customers who dont sign up for VIP number?
Do we need to keep track of those customers?
that's why I kept the purchases separate from the customers

apparently i did.
I think we should tkae the setGold and the summary methods from my Customer class to add to your VIPCustomer class.
since they directly access the database to get th emost recent purchases.
I assumed you were going the other way....using my model to create better classes.  Since your coding is much cleaner I rather go from mine to yours unless you have lot of work to do yet.
My model works for most part.
So depending on how your classes are doing we can make a decision.
we need to agree what to do with which then.
So with regards to customers
Did you implement all the data model?

ok.
let me look at your Customer class...
it should be in the src folder

cool.  I'll work with that tonight, and post here when it's up.

@OmarRamos  can you look at DatabaseHelperJSON.java and see if what I'm doing in createCustomer is the correct way to implement JSON requests for your db?

@TonyPotter It's looking pretty close, though instead of using sockets, it might be easier to make use of the HttpClient class that seems to be included within Android (from what I can see). The ServiceHandler class on this page seems like pretty similar to your class, but uses HttpClient instead: http://www.androidhive.info/2012/01/android-json-parsing-tutorial/
ok, i'll work more later.

I'm almost done with the docs (I'm double-checking things as I'm going through creating them). I'll upload the code to the livesite before I go to bed so it should be available in the morning to run some tests if we wish ;-)
kk thanks!

@TonyPotter Hopefully now with using the HttpClient stuff you should be able to remove some of the java.sql.* and java.net.* imports at the top of your file once it's all converted ;-)
ok, i'll continue on this vein.

One quick thing I noticed, which might cause an issue with getCustomer() is that the request should be an HttpGet vs. an HttpPost (if it's left as a POST you'll probably get a 404 response automatically, which happens when the request doesn't match any of the accepted ones...so if you notice a 404 response right away it should indicate there was an issue with the URL or the GET was used instead of POST, etc.)
guys...I think its time to test what we have...even if you get the db connection completed we wont be able to integrate in time.
We can continue on db after we finalize our submission.
yup we should have plenty of time to integrate the web service API portion in the coming week
I've been holding off testing the app since I knew you were both working on the updates
so i can start doing some testing this morning
the app is working on the data model from last week...we should clean out any bugs and submit.
Just quickly testing...when adding an item to the cart should any info be displayed back on the main screen currently? I'm not seeing any updates on the main screen at the moment
notedd
@OmarRamos use the back button at the top - I am looking into why the bottom back is not working.
thanks, that worked!
Were there going to be two separate buttons (one to add a coffee, one to add a dessert) on the main page?
yes - but it messed up the layout so I deleted it for the moment.  you can use the bottom for desserts.
That's what I ended up trying which worked
After Checkout can we clear out the currently selected Customer automatically? (Empty Cart works perfeclty)
Do you want to...
Have to reselect if you want to buy more...

The way I'm seeing it, usually you have a line of folks coming to get their stuff so once the checkout is completed it should clear everything out so you can start fresh with the process again with the next person (technically you can still do this now because you can still click on the button and type in the next person's vip card number, but clearing out the value would make it clearer I think that we're starting with a new transaction)

Pre-Orders should be a completely different screen (right now you can intermingle that info with a regular order). Also, we're not able to choose a Requested Date for a Pre-Ordered Item when we select that option...having a separate screen to handle pre-orders should help us to add the Requested Date field along with the appropriate checks (to see if the Pre-Order slots have all been taken already or not)
preorder logic not implemented in the data model...I was hoping to use Tony's.  @TonyPotter did you implement preorder slots?
I haven't implemented PreOrder logic yet.

It's implemented in the Web Service API side of things, (just for reference: https://github.com/gt-ud-softeng/cs6300-summer-team22/blob/Deliverable3/6300Sum14Project2/php-webservice-api/docs/preorders.md)
